fields.description:
Repro:

# Create a date custom field
## Assign it to a specific project context
# Create an Agile Board that does not use that project
# Configure the board to add the new date field to the Issue Detail View
# Go back to the board and view an issue's detail view

Error message is shown.
fields.summary: "Field type is not supported for issue details"
document median time shown for Control Chart

fields.description:
If you have any Epics in GH in the same board, you will have multiple issues associated to each Epic.
However, the burndown chart displays every single issue in the active sprint.

We should have an option to check a chart of a specific Epic/feature.
fields.summary: Ability to configure the burndown chart

fields.description:
Check discussion on AAC
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/104490/how-to-assign-an-issue-to-a-greenhopper-sprint/104867

When you are looking at an issue (not in the context of the planning board), you should be able to indicate in what sprint you want this issue to be done.   This is typical when you encounter the issue while triaging, and you know that you are going to address similar issues in a future sprint.



Also related to GHS-4949
fields.summary: As a user, I want to assign an issue to a specific sprint, (like I can assign it to a fix version), such that the issue is planned

fields.description:
# Open Create Issue and choose an issue type which is not Epic
# Cancel
# Open Create Epic
# Cancel
# Open Create Issue

(x) selected issue type is Epic and not the first thing you chose

firefox windows
fields.summary: Last issue type used in Create Issue dialog is not remembered after using Create Epic dialog

fields.description:
# Bug issue type has special Field Configuration which hides A Date Picker
# Field is still shown on Detail View

Not restricted to Date custom fields, also happened with another one "Calcutta's Arc"
fields.summary: Date custom field which is hidden in Field Configuration shows up on Detail View

fields.description: There was also a custom field type called "Date of First Response", but its not a JIRA core one and therefore could be not showing up because of the way it is implemented.
fields.summary: Date Fields configuration for Issue Detail View does not allow you to pick Due Date or Resolution Date

fields.description:
When working in Kanban boards for projects that don't require an estimate process, we still need log our time spent working on the tickets. Currently, we need to open the ticket in the traditional issue detail's view in order to check if we have added any time already. We would like to have better visibility of the logged time without leaving the Greenhopper boards.

I see two possible solutions for this issue.

1. Add the "Logged time" to the Issue Details tab in the right hand side panel.

2. Add a new tab for "Work log" to the Issue Details panel on the right hand side.

I prefer option #2 as this would allow us to add/edit/delete our logged time without leaving the boards.
fields.summary: Add "Logged time" to the Issue Details tab or add "Work Log" tab

fields.description:
I have read articles by atlassian about the value of story points. This convinced us to use story points on stories. For our daily work we break our stories down to tasks. In order for our developers to get an idea of what they are doing they need to assign hours (up to a max of 4) to those tasks, eventually we are striving to leave out the hours, we're not there yet.

These hours are however not shown in the 'work' screen (agile board) on the cards. I noticed that they become visible when I change the 'Estimation Statistic' to 'Original time estimate'. I wonder if it's possible to show them in 'Story Points' mode as well.

I have read about the issue with card configuration (that it might hinder redesign of the cards). But since it's already on the card in one mode, I was wondering if you could add a checkbox that would allow it to always be displayed on the cards?
fields.summary: Card in work mode does not show hours when in story point mode

fields.description: This should not be necessary because statistics for issues not belonging to an epic are not displayed anywhere.
fields.summary: Epics data is reloaded when editing the estimate of an issue not assigned to any epic

fields.description: This could now be improved given that we have the ability to reload only epics data.
fields.summary: All board data is reloaded when assigning/unassigning issues from epics

fields.description: Issues assume a secondary selection colouring when an epic is selected.  see https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/Epics+Selection+Scheme
fields.summary: Implement secondary selection scheme on planning board : epics/issues

fields.description:
We would love to integrate Structure plugin with the new GreenHopper epics in the right way - through GreenHopper API. 

We would like to:
- query which epic an issue belongs to (receiving just issue ID would be fine)
- query which issues does an epic contain (likewise, issue IDs would do)
- change assigned epic for an issue
- get notified when an epic changes (can be done through the standard issue events -- as of version 6.0.6, no events are fired)

It would be awesome if we could:
- query epics in bulk, if that improves performance
- update epics in bulk, if that improves performance
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I would like to have an API to the new Epics implementation
Ability to clone an issue without cloning Agile sprint information

fields.description: Customer would like to maintain the quickfilter status when switching between plan and work.
fields.summary: Maintain quick filter when switching between plan and work boards
As a user, I would like to be able to associate an issue to an Epic from JIRA

fields.description:
COS:
- Show like the label
- Can't remove it

in the agile box

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Can you edit the value there?
A: (/) No

Q: Can you see this information as an anonymous user?
A: (/) Yes
fields.summary: As a PO, I'd like to see the Epic of a story in JIRA view issue

fields.description:
COS:
- 'Issues in Epic' panel
- Immediately beneath the sub tasks panel
- Looks like the sub tasks panel
-- No "Plus" button to create new issues
-- No dropdown to filter issues
-- No numbered list
-- Prepend summary with issue key
-- Fields: done-ness icon, issue key, summary, issue type icon, status, assignee
-- Include issue operations cog per issue
-- Order by "default" rank field
- Don't show if there are no linked issues

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: How does this perform with a large number issues?
A: should be fine

Q: What if you dont have permission to see some of the issues? Or not logged in?
A: Only issues which the user has permission to see will be displayed in the list.

Q: Any support or infrastructure for possible bulk edit functionality?
A: No

Q: View in issue nav link?
A: No

Q: What if there are non-stories with an epic link? Story was converted to something else?
A: Any issue currently linked to the epic via the Epic Link field will be displayed.

Q: What if epics have an epic link? (also converted from story)
A: see above
fields.summary: As a PO, I'd like to see the stories of an Epic in JIRA view issue

fields.description:
1. Configure SCRUM Rapid board to have Swimlanes based on Stories and Estimation statistic based on Story Points
2. Create Story with 5 Story Points and multiple subtasks
3. Start Sprint with issues created above included
4. Move Sub-task to In Progress status

Expected results: When a subtask within a story is in progress, the parent story should also be marked as in progress. This should be reflected on the Plan mode, in the colored indicators for estimating how many issues are in each status. See screenshot for clarification

Current behavior: The parent Story status is what reflects the colored indicators estimation in Plan mode.
fields.summary: As a user I would like Sub-task status to be reflected in Plan mode estimation indicators (Swimlanes based on Stories)

fields.description: Colors for burndown and time spent lines are red and green, which is a problem for the 10% of the male population who is color blind.
fields.summary: Make burndown charts accessible for colorblind people

fields.description:
The team I'm in had our 5 next sprints all planned out, which is something the Greenhopper planning UI somewhat encourages by saying "Plan some sprints".

Somebody accidentally deleted the second one by hitting the subtle grey (x) in the top corner of the sprint.

Re-adding it again is impossible.  We have to rename all the sprints and shuffle the work down each one.  Due to a single mis-click.

If adding sprints to the middle is impossible, I suggest that deleting them from the middle also should be.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a confirmation when I delete a future sprint so that I don't accidentally lose all my work

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create SCRUM rapid board.
2. Configure Swimlanes to be based on Assignees
3. Create a Story with a Sub-task
4. Transition Sub-task to different status than parent Story

Current behavior is that you are unable to click on the Story parent's Issue key for viewing the detail pane.

Desired behavior is that the parent Story Issue Key will be a link that expands the detail pane on the work board.

See screenshot for clarification.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to click parent Story issue key above Sub-tasks to view detail pane (only applies to Assignee based swimlanes)

fields.description: As a member of an agile team, I would like to be able to assign Issues to 2 team members so I can see who's pairing who on the team and for either pair member to be able to report out at stand ups.
fields.summary: Add support for pairing

fields.description:
Imagine if you have a huge amount of *backlog* issues and under circumstances, you have to move an issue that is at the bottom of the *Backlog* all the way to the ongoing *Sprint*.
!long_backlog.JPG!

Any thoughts on how this can be improved so that you do not have to go through the trouble of scrolling all the way up?
fields.summary: Improvement on how to handle extremely long Backlogs

fields.description: It would be helpful to see the total issue count and the sum of estimates for the remaining backlog. I suggest that the top of the backlog is the best place to show this.
fields.summary: Add the backlog issue count and sum of estimates to the Backlog title line

fields.description:
Currently, the sub-tasks are displayed in the *Issue Detail* tab that appears when you click on an individual issue as per the following screenshot:
!subtask_rapid.JPG!

A suggestion is to *enhance* this feature by providing an option to display under the parent issue with some sort of indentation. One of the best example would be like the one in the *Work* mode of the *Rapid Board* which uses [swimlanes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+Work+Mode]. As an example, the usage of *Swimlane by Queries*:
!swimlane.jpg!
fields.summary: Improvement on the current view of the Rapid Board on Sub-tasks

fields.description: It would be helpful to see the total issue count and the sum of estimates for a planned sprint on the same line as the name of the sprint, i.e., beside "Start Sprint", instead of at the bottom of the list of issues for the sprint.
fields.summary: Move issue count and estimate sum from the bottom of the "future sprint bracket" to the top

fields.description:
The RB is a great feature in GreenHopper. We have a kanban and a scrum board with multiple projects. The board is set up to use projects as swimlanes (via JQL). 

For our organisation it is very useful to see the projects and the work each assignee has. 
Because of the large number of users a quick filter dropdown list with all possible assignees would make it easier for us to simultanously see:
* in which projects the assignee is working
* which issues are assigned to the user

Using quick filters for projects and setting the swimlanes to assignees is not an option for us. This is because:
* when selecting multiple filters for projects there are no issues belonging to two projects at the same time, so the query does not return any values
* we have to be able to see the work of one assignee at the time, with the work divided over several projects (this is due to the fact that our teammembers work in several projects simultanously)

Resolving this would be very helpful for our planners en managers.
fields.summary: User dropdown in RB quick filters

fields.description:
For example you could click on the sprint or on the backlog and the applied filters would be used and JQL generated to show the issues you are looking at on the issue navigator. 

I cant tell you how many times people have asked me for this internally. People look very confused when I tell them that you can no longer do this on a rapid board. 

Please consider this for an upcoming release.
fields.summary: As a GH6 rapid board user I need a way to jump to the issues navigator and show the issues that are selected or displayed on the planning baord

fields.description: I don't want to remove the classic views just in case we need to go back to them, but I do want to disable the menu item so that people have to use the new rapid boards.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator I would like a disable classic menu item in the GH labs so that I can stop people using the classic view

fields.description: Please see the highlighted image attached for a graphical example
fields.summary: As a greenhopper rapid board user I want a collapsible option on all sprints not just the active one so that I quickly move to upcoming sprint work

fields.description:
The functionality for drag-and-drop transitioning is great. 

For our organisation it would also be useful to be able to drag-and-drop issues between assignee swimlanes, thus (re)assigning them. This would make the process of planning and assigning issues a lot faster and easier to use for us.
fields.summary: As a user, i would like to drag en drop assign issues

fields.description:
In our organisation (100+ licenses) we have multiple projects, each with their own set of sprints. For planning and management purposes we have one Scrum Board set up for all the projects.

It would be useful for us to be able to simultanously select multiple sprints from the sprint filters. Creating a custom query everytime we complete a sprint is quite a pain for our project- and programmanagers.
fields.summary: As a user, i would like to simultanously select multiple sprints on work view
update docs for "Viewing an Issue" - Resolution, Environment and Security Level added to Issue Detail View

fields.description:
Please edit the following documentation: 

[GreenHopper 6.0.3 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.0.3+Release+Notes]

The following [session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.0.3+Release+Notes#GreenHopper6.0.3ReleaseNotes-EasiermanagementofRemainingEstimate] under *Easier management of Remaining Estimate* is quite confusing:

{quote}
In Plan mode, the sprint footer will now display the sum of the Remaining Estimate of all of the issues and sub-tasks in the future sprint. Note that the the value will not be shown if the board is configured to use the Original Time Estimate as the Estimation Statistic and the sum of the Original Estimates on the issues is the same as the sum of the Remaining Estimates on the issues and sub-tasks.
{quote}

The last phrase in particular is really confusing.

Thanks!
Clarissa.
fields.summary: Edit the release notes for Greenhopper 6.0.3

fields.description:
The workflow we use for Scrum adds an additional "Verified" step after Resolved, and the columns on the Rapidboard are set up to have In Progress and Resolved as partially complete, followed by Verified as the state for the "Done" column.

There is no direct transition from In Progress to Verified, requiring two steps to move from In Progress to Resolved to Verified. However, when all subtasks are complete on a story (that is, in the Done column), the "Move to Done" transition button appears even though the parent Story is still In Progress. 

Attempting to click Move to Done brings up a lightbox indicating there's no valid transition.

We can easily workaround this by moving the Story to Resolved first, but it seems like there's a better experience that could be put together. 

This seems to relate potentially to GHS-6063.

It should be possible to set the behaviour of the parent story to one of the either:
- be able to pre-select the status that a parent should be transitioned to when all subtasks are complete;
- disable the automated parent transition altogether.
fields.summary: "Move to Done" button appears regardless of whether the transition is valid

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to quickly bulk edit the issues associated with my sprint while within the board. 

Currently, to do this I have to:
1) navigate to a specific issue in my sprint so that I can edit it. 
2) Click on the sprint field to edit so that I know what the sprint internal ID is
3) Navigate to the issue navigator and create the query of sprint = <insert ID> 
4) perform the bulk updates
5) Then usually click on Agile > select board to return back to the board that they were working with. 

The most common bulk update is to associate a Fix Version since: 
1) You cannot edit fix version in Greenhopper
2) When you have several stories in one sprint, editing individually is time consuming
3) There is no tie between a sprint and a jira fix version.  We want to see all sprints associated with a release and a release is associated with a fix version
4) Management has no clue what sprints are in work and associated with different versions. Thus, they use fix version for dashboard reporting; but, to use those, they need to have sprints tied to fixversion

The issues with the above stpes:
1) No user has any idea how to create a sprint query as no user expects to have to locate an internal ID reference.  Then, you have to know how to get it since you cannot get to it within Greenhopper

2) The users want to stay in the context of their board as they are usually doing planning. 

The user wants to have a bulk edit action of all selected sprint items to be able to use to make any updates. (whether they are fixversion updates, assignment changes, etc.)
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to easily bulk edit my sprint content

fields.description:
...even if I'm using story points for user story estimates, so that I can easily check the total work load during sprint planning. 

We use story points for user story estimates, and hours for the tasks the stories are broken down to during sprint planning. We then check the total amount of hours vs the available capacity for the team (accounting for holidays etc). 

Today we have to calculate the total amount of hours manually (summing the total shown on each story), but it would be nice to have the amount of hours estimated for the sprint shown next to the totals for the story points and number of issues totals for a sprint on the Plan board.
fields.summary: As a product owner I would like to see the sum of the estimated time remaining for all issues in both a planned and running sprint

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Start with an instance which has GreenHopper installed and the Epic issue type created by GreenHopper
# Delete all issues of type Epic
# Delete Epic Issue Type via JIRA admin
# Enable Epics Support labs feature
# Go to an Agile Board and go to Plan Mode

You will see a red error message "Internal Server Error" and no Plan Mode information will be displayed. In the console and server logs you will find this stack trace:

{code}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2012-11-02 15:29:30,144 http-2990-6 ERROR admin 929x3476x1 17uppd5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/data.json [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.NullPointerException
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getPlanModeClause(RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.java:108)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getClauseForBuilder(RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.java:70)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.getBacklogQuery(RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.java:189)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.getBacklogQuery(RapidViewQueryServiceImpl.java:167)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.list.RapidIssueEntryQueryServiceImpl.collectBacklogIssues(RapidIssueEntryQueryServiceImpl.java:165)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource.loadBacklogData(PlanningModeResource.java:220)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource.access$300(PlanningModeResource.java:59)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource$1.call(PlanningModeResource.java:130)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource$1.call(PlanningModeResource.java:115)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:48)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:48)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeResource.getBacklogData(PlanningModeResource.java:114)
{code}

*Workaround*

Refer to the following KB article to fix the Epic issue type association in database:

[Unable to access Planning mode due to at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getPlanModeClause|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Unable+to+access+Planning+mode+due+to+at+com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.RapidViewClauseServiceImpl.getPlanModeClause]
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when accessing Plan Mode with Epics enabled
Create Issue link in header should not open 'Create Card', but rather open the non quick create JIRA screens
GreenHopper enforces the "All apps must be accessible by the current user to be able to create projects" condition, which is no longer enforced by JIRA

fields.description:
In a scrum rapid board, perform the following actions:

# Create a Story
# Add it to a sprint
# Start the sprint
# Try to change the story estimate. It is not possible.
# Click on the issue and hit 'e' on the keyboard. If the Story Point field is visible, you can change it through the JIRA issue.

At a first glance, this behavior is not consistent. Could it be that we need to make this available through the Rapid Board also or there is some specific reason for that?
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I would like to edit the Story Points of an issue in the active sprint through the Rapid Board

fields.description: Currently the rapid board only allows to attach a file while Jira allows adding a screenshot via cut&paste. I like to have the some functionality provided via the Rapid Board. Why is the Rapid worse than JIRA issue editing itself. Being "rapid" you should support this rapid way of pasting images.
fields.summary: As a User I like to be able to attach a screenshot directly to an issue

fields.description:

Actual:
Unassigned swim lane on bottom

Expected:
Shows on top

fields.description:
This creates a pretty significant performance regression for instances with large backlogs.

It does not only affect issues assigned to an epic - it affects all issues with estimates when Epics Support is enabled.

A quick workaround could be to only reload all data if the Epic Panel is open. We will have to fix the problem properly later.

Currently, the 'required daily burndown rate' only available in the Classic Chart Board.

The 'required daily burndown rate' should also available in the new report.
fields.summary: Include the 'required daily burndown rate' in the new board

fields.description: My recommendation would be to put something in GreenHopper Labs that allows me to re-promote the Classic Boards back to first class citizens in the menu.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I need a solution to release management, therefore I'd like to have a way to promote the Classic Boards back to the main Agile menu, so that I don't have to train people on where to go find them.

fields.description: Currently, there is no way to push some default configurations (default quick filters, swimlanes, no. of columns, min/max counts in each column) to all the boards that one uses? We have a number of boards and since the process around them is still evolving, it becomes tough to have all the scrum masters use a few configurations by default along with their own.
fields.summary: Enable Common Configuration for all the boards

fields.description:
As per the description, it would be useful if the *Story Points* is displayed in a bracket or any other indicators when the sprint starts like the following. Even though the stories does not have *Estimation*, this makes it easier to recognize rather than nothing is displayed:
!story_point_indicator.jpg!
fields.summary: Current estimation for issues should be shown in brackets in the Sprint Report (if it differs from sprint start estimate)

fields.description:
It looks like the only way for plugin devs to access the rapid board services is through REST. 

It seems impossible to import the RapidViewService component. I am not sure if it is because it is not defined directly but rather through classloader scanning, so it is not declared public. The corresponding interface in the GH API module lacks the get methods that we need.
fields.summary: As a plugin developer I would like access to RapidViewService

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6471].
  {panel}

 In GreenHopper, it is possible for us to configure the a scrum board filter to include other projects, or only include certain issues of a project by attributes as needed. Because of this, there's a possibility that users may accidentally include a sub task to a Sprint while actually the parent task is excluded from the Sprint. When this scenario happen, the following error will be produced if we try to generate a Sprint Report:
!scshot1.png!

A simple steps to reproduce the problem:
- Create a new project with 1 issue having 1 subtask
- Create a scrum board for the project
- Go to the Plan board and include the parent issue in a Sprint (subtask won't be displayed in the plan board). Start the Sprint
- Modify the board filter (Configure > Filter > View in Issue Navigator), exclude the parent task from the filter. Save.
- Back to the Scrum, try to generate Sprint Report and the problem is reproducible.

It'll be great if we have the feature to exclude a sub task if the parent issue is not included, or add a more meaningful message that may help customer to understand the root cause of the problem. 

h3. Workaround
Remove the subtask without the parent from the JIRA Agile (formerly GreenHopper) board. Identifying the problematic issues is not a trivial process, and can be done with either of the following workarounds:

h5. Using JQL

# Identify the board which is causing the problems and copy the filter from it in *Board > Configure > Filter > Filter Query*. For example:
{noformat}
project = "Sample Scrum Project" ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
# Add {{AND type not in subTaskIssueTypes()}} to it (see the below example) and then search for that filter in the Issue Navigator, so as to return all the parent issues.
{noformat}
project = "Sample Scrum Project" AND type not in subTaskIssueTypes() ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
# Those issuekeys will need be collected and collated for comparison against a filter again. This can either by done by exporting the results to CSV and extracting them from there, or by using the Javascript in step 4 & 5.
# Using Chrome, open the [Chrome Developer Tools|https://developers.google.com/chrome-developer-tools/docs/overview#access], select the console and add the following Javascript to it. Make sure to press enter after adding the Javascript.
{code:javascript}
AJS.$(document).ajaxSuccess(function(e, obj) { try{ console.log(JSON.parse(obj.responseText).issueTable.issueKeys.join(',')) } catch(e) {} })
{code}
(i) You should see the below appear after entering to confirm the JS went through:
!Document.png!
# Reload to filter and the issue keys will be put together in the console as below:
!Issues.png!
# Take those issue keys and add them into the JQL query from step 2, put them inside the {{and parent not in ()}} section and change the {{not in subTaskIssueTypes()}} to {{in subTaskIssueTypes()}}. See the below example:
{noformat}
project = "Sample Scrum Project" AND type in subTaskIssueTypes() and parent not in (SSP-1,SSP-2,SSP-3,SSP-4,SSP-5,SSP-6,SSP-8,SSP-9,SSP-10,SSP-13,SSP-14,SSP-15,SSP-16,SSP-17,SSP-18,SSP-19,SSP-20,SSP-21,SSP-22,SSP-23) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
(i) This will search for all parent issues that do not exist within the board.
# Remove those subtasks from the board.

h5. Using SQL

In order to find out all the subtasks without their parent, you may use the following queries: 
# Run the following query in the database and get the id of the subtask link: 
{code:sql}
SELECT * 
FROM   issuelinktype 
WHERE  linkname LIKE '%subtask%'; 
{code}
# After this run the following query in the database, substituting the value for 'Link Type Id' by the id derived from the above SQL:
*Before JIRA 6.1:*
{code:sql}
SELECT ji2.pkey AS "parent issue key", 
       ji1.pkey AS "child issue key" 
FROM   issuelink il 
       JOIN jiraissue ji1 
         ON ji1.id = il.destination 
       JOIN jiraissue ji2 
         ON ji2.id = il.source 
WHERE  il.linktype = <Link Type Id>;
{code}
*After JIRA 6.1:*
{code:sql}
SELECT p.pkey AS "parent project key",
    ji2.issuenum AS "parent issue num",
    q.pkey AS "child project key", 
       ji1.issuenum AS "child issue num" 
FROM   issuelink il 
       JOIN jiraissue ji1 
         ON ji1.id = il.destination 
       JOIN jiraissue ji2 
         ON ji2.id = il.source 
       JOIN project p
        ON ji1.project = p.id
       JOIN project q
        ON ji2.project = q.id 
WHERE  il.linktype = <Link Type Id>;
{code}

(i) This query will list all the sub task type of issues with their parents. You can now compare the subtasks from your filter query and verify if their parents are present on the board by looking up their parent id from the query results.
fields.summary: GreenHopper shouldn't allow sub task to be listed in the scrum board if the parent issue is excluded
As a product owner, I'd like a summary/statistics gadget for the new boards (similar to the info page from the Agile gadget)
As a product owner, I'd like a project progress gadget for the new boards (similar to the classic project progress gadget)

fields.description:
- this is to mimic the behaviour of the burndown chart of the board

# The sprint value can be chosen by the user. The default value is auto (the one that ends first)
# No configuration to change estimation statistic
# Needs to be wallboard compatible
# Call it "Sprint Burndown" gadget

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Will Wallboard Mode be compatible for all supported browsers (IE specifically)?
A: (/) Works but with some adjustments on IE8 (because of quirks mode)

Q: What if a user does not have permission to see a project configured in the gadget? (either a single project or one out of multi-project board)
A: (/) Will get an error message saying that the board can not be find

Q: What if the sprint has run over its end-date?
A: (/) Same as burndown chart

Q: Does the y-axis adjust if there is scope addition? Do the tickmarks readjust?
A: (/) Yes, thanks to flot

Q: What if there is no active sprint?
A: (/)  Displays a message like "could not find an active sprint"

Q: What if the active sprint has only issues that are in a project that the user does not have permission for?
A: (/) Will get an error message saying that the board can not be find

Q: Can the user hover over data points in the chart?
A: (/) The user can't for now
fields.summary: As a product owner, I'd like a burndown gadget for the new boards (similar to the existing Classic Burndown gadget)

fields.description:
# Same defaults when choosing the sprint as in GHS-6467
# Needs to take non-working days into account (we should make it explicit in the description of the gadget)
# Mimic behaviour of classic version of the gadget otherwise
# Wallboard compatible
# Call it "Days Remaining in Sprint" gadget

(!) Development Notes (!)
Q: What happens if a user doesn't have permission to access a project in the gadget?
A: (/) No permission error message?

Q: Will the days remaining be calculated in the server timezone or adjusted to user timezone? (I think it would have to follow the server timezone to be accurate for remote teams)
A: (/) User's timezone

Q: Do the days remaining honor the time of day that the sprint ends?
A: (/) Yes

Q: What is displayed if there is no active sprint?
A: (/) No active sprint error message

Q: What is displayed if the sprint has been closed?
A: (/) 0 Days Remaining
fields.summary: As a product owner, I'd like a days remaining in sprint gadget for the new boards (similar to the days remaining gadget)
As a product owner, I'd like a cumulative flow chart gadget that can show the flow for a new board (similar to the classic cumulative flow chart gadget for the new boards)
As a product owner, I'd a gadget that scrolls individual stories from a sprint (i.e the card view gadget to work with the new boards)

fields.description:
COS:
- Also remember your 'All' or 'Custom' preference for fields 
- None of this applies to the Create Epic dialog

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens if you switch modes or go to config before you create an issue? Aka how long do we queue up this memory?
A: It's reset when the dialog is hidden. If you refresh the page with the dialog open, it doesn't get reset. 

Q: What happens if you edit an issue first, changing the fields that are shown there, then try quick create?
A: Quick Edit and Quick Create customisation are independent.

Q: What happens when you open the create dialog but then close it, and reopen again to actually create?
A: (/) it's good
fields.summary: Restore "Create Issue" dialog preferences after Epic is created

fields.description:
COS: 
- After Scrum / Kanban choice allow (a) selection of existing projects (b) selection of a filter (c) creation of a new project
- Link the Getting Started links in to this new dialog (with the appropriate selection, i.e. create sample kanban project goes to the second step of the dialog with 'Sample Data' selected)
- Kill off "Advanced"
fields.summary: Allow it to be possible to create a project at the same time as creating a board

fields.description:
COS:

* Clicking Create Epic loads Quick Create form with just the minimum fields shown, always (despite preference for "All" vs "Custom" fields in the Quick Create config)
* Subsequent usage of Quick Create (not explicitly for epics) should show the fields that are configured for my preferences (i.e. revert back to "All" if that was my preference before creating epics)
fields.summary: As a planner, I would like to see the "bare minimum" quick create form for creating epics, even if my preference for regular quick create is to see all fields

fields.description: When editing a sprint to include a ticket, you are forced to go lookup the sprint ID in the database to figure out what it is. This is ridiculous. Every other field in the ticket is also backed by an id column, but you show the names for them.
fields.summary: When editing a ticket, you are forced to enter unique sprint index from database

fields.description: There is a ridiculous amount of carpal-tunnel creating work involved in stopping a sprint and moving on to the next one. Every issue which remains unfinished has to be manually dragged up into the new sprint. How likely is an unfinished item to not be in the new sprint? Why aren't they autopopulated there in planning mode?
fields.summary: Move all items in completed sprint to the new sprint.

fields.description:
Currently only POST is supported for /quickfilters/{rapidViewId}
If GET was implemented, then a developer could easily fetch current quickfilters for a board.
fields.summary: As a developer I would like to access quickfilters via REST

fields.description:
The classic boards allowed easy creation of a new issue that had fields set based on the context of the current board.  This had the effect that issues are created within the current sprint without people having to think about it.

With the RapidBoards this is no longer the case, only the top level "Create Issue" link is still available which appears to be unaware of its context. This is causing frustration within our teams.
fields.summary: As a user I want to easily add new issues to the current sprint from the RapidBoards

fields.description:
With a single team working through a backlog, it makes perfect sense to have a single RapidBoard restricted to one active sprint.  We operate with two teams running off a single backlog and can't see how to do so effectively from the RapidBoard.

Ideally we'd all use the same RapidBoard and set the "active sprint" limit to 2 so that both teams can have a sprint active.

Instead we figured that each team would create a separate RapidBoard pointing at the same backlog but now it seems that the 2nd team still sees the 1st team's open sprint and is blocked from creating a new one.  How are we supposed to operate two teams from a single backlog?

If we're going to be forced down the route of maintaining per-team backlogs then we're going to need some better tools for managing multiple backlogs and easily moving issues between them.

(All of this works quite easily with per-team sub-versions in the classic boards btw)
fields.summary: As a user I want to run multiple sprints concurrently so that multiple teams can work from a single backlog

fields.description: Atm we have to add certain fields everytime we create a new Scrum Rapid board. It would save a lot of time, to be able to add to the default created boards, so fields always needed didn't have to be added everytime.
fields.summary: Change default issue details view

fields.description:
Hi,

At the moment it seems that rapid boards do not allow configuring the fields which appear on the cards in the rapid board.

For that reason, I'm still using the Classic view.

2 questions:

1. When is the classic view going to be removed, if ever?
2. When are the cards in rapid boards going to be configurables?
fields.summary: Configuring fields which appear on cards in rapid board
When a board is first created and accessed by a user the Epic panel should be open (unless explicitly closed)

fields.description:
spoke to Tokes about this this morning.

See treatment at:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/Epics+Selection+Scheme
fields.summary: Update selected epic treatment

fields.description: This doesn't apply just to epics - anything with a bounding box while dragging with other content outside the bounding box.
fields.summary: Opinion: Let's have a "cancel" cursor icon when we pull the cursor away from the epics column while draggin.

fields.description:
our arguments for floating right were that we'd get a rag edge anyway if people were doing time as estimate.  and we didn't want to steal valuable real estate from non-estimated issues.

However I am feeling like the estimates "column" is polluted by labels, and that I do think of this as a column.
fields.summary: Opinion: let's align the epic labels after all

fields.description: Note it also doesn't cancel edit for sprint name
fields.summary: Investigate how inline edit and blur events work together across GH usage of inline edit
Epics panel should be open by default first time each user visits the plan mode screen

fields.description: IE10 layout issues caused by styles expected to be only served to earlier versions now being shown since MS dropped conditional comments in IE10.
fields.summary: IE10 dropdown and inline-dialog layout issues

fields.description:
This is a placeholder story for adding more time based statistics of each epic into the Epics Panel:

* Due date (inline editable -- split into another story?)
* "In Sprints" -- which sprints stories of an epic have been in
fields.summary: As a planner, I would like to see more "time" information about an epic in the Epics Panel

fields.description:
COS:
- Issuetype should be their last issue type unless it was Epic in which case it should default to story
- Use Quick Create
- If they choose Epic let them create the Epic but don't do association

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What happens if there is no Epic issuetype?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens after creating subtasks?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens after a Quick Edit, of an epic or story?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Is there an alert that will indicate to a user that the issuetype field has changed under them?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if the issuetype field is not displayed on that screen?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if it is restricted to a particular group?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As a planner, I would like a way to create new issues for an epic, so that the issues are automatically assigned to the epic

fields.description:
COS: 
- Need separate scrolling for long Epic lists

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens if there are error messages in the page as well?
A: (/) Error messages have an absolute position so they are not influenced by the epics pane.

Q: How well does this work with all browsers?
A: (/) Tested on IE8, IE9, last Firefox, last Safari and last Chrome.

Q: What happens when the epics tab is very long and you scroll in it or in the main pane?
A: (/) The epics pane has its own scrollbar, so when the content is longer than the available visible height, a scrollbar appears.

Q: Try a combination of clicks and scrolls with epics/issues selected.
A: (/) Bad behaviour when the view port is smaller than the minimum JIRA supported size, but it is normal.

Q: What happens if the detail view is closed?
A: (/) The epic pane is not influenced by the detail view.
fields.summary: As a planner with a long backlog, I would like the Epics Panel to stalk the backlog as I scroll down
As a Scrum Master I would like ability to assign issues by dragging and dropping between assignee swimlanes

fields.description:
Going to a RB where previously an epic was selected which doesn't exist anymore (e.g. as it has been deleted) still shows the epic key in the url and shows all issues as being filtered out

Expected behaviour: Remove epic selection and show all issues
fields.summary: Selected Epic not cleared when not available

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have a consistent, and accurate message displayed when I have configured my rapid board to show no issues. Examples:

1. My quick filter results in nothing appearing in the backlog. Currently, the message shown is: "There are currently no issues in the backlog" This should be improved to say: "There are currently no issues in the backlog which match your quick filter."

2. I select an Epic with no sub issues. Currently, there is no message shown at all. This message should be added to meet the same format: "There are currently no issues in the backlog which match your selected Epic."

Another possible implementation method would be to take the WIP issue count from Kanban boards and apply it to the backlog as well. Screenshot of this attached. Though telling a user what is causing them to be hidden may also be helpful.
fields.summary: Improve user feedback when no issues are on Rapid Board

fields.description: It would be great if there was already a preconfigured option for epics when basing swimlanes when configuring the scrum board.
fields.summary: It would be helpful for a user to be able to select epic as a preconfigured swimlane on the scrum boards

fields.description:
A request to add another [Report Mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+Report+Mode] that shows ALL *Resolved* issues. This includes the ID displayed as a link and *summary* to the issue.

A good example is the table shown in the [Browsing a Project's Change Log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Browsing+a+Project%27s+Change+Log]:
!change_log.png!
fields.summary: Request to have a new Report Mode

fields.description: After selecting a specific Epic, it is not clear how I can display the full Backlog list again. After a while I discovered I had to click again in the Epic name.
fields.summary: How to show full Backlog after selecting specific Epic is not clear

fields.description:
A suggestion to have a " configurable header" added to the *GreenHopper Rapid Board Plan Mode* that shows columns like the one in the [Issue Navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Issue+Navigator].

In addition to that, it would also be good to have the ability to add more columns to it including *Related Project(s)* (if you are using the board for multiple projects).
fields.summary: Rapid Board "header" to be included in the Plan mode

fields.description: Allow starting the sprint without specifying the *End Date*, means that add the ability to close the sprint manually if the *End Date* is not specified.
fields.summary: Allow starting the sprint without specifying the *End Date*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6421].
  {panel}

When a *Sprint* is completed, it would be useful to have the ability to decide where *Unresolved* issues should go, either:
# to the *backlog*
# to any other *existing sprint*

Same should apply to removing Issues from an ongoing Sprint.
fields.summary: Option to decide where Unresolved Issues go to after a Sprint is completed or after being removed from Sprint

fields.description:
When you add the 'Sprint' field to the 'Default Screen', is there anyway to validate against completed or non-existing sprints.

For example:
If the Sprint with ID:1 is completed so at any new created issues when the user tries to input the sprint ID:1 into the *Sprint* field, that should warn the user since this sprint is completed.

Same goes to non-existing sprints.
fields.summary: Validate 'Sprint' field from any non-existing or completed sprints
GH upper bound on OSGi Package-Import means it can't be used in JIRA 6.0 snapshots

fields.description:
Using a rapid view on EAN; someone has closed our current sprint and I can't find out who did it. There doesn't seem to be any kind of activity log for this.

This is bad because I don't know why they did it, nor can I tie them in a burlap bag and beat them with reeds to encourage them not to close other peoples' sprints ;)
fields.summary: Can't find out who closed a sprint

fields.description:
COS:
* Write an upgrade task to find all epics with a resolution set, and set the Epic Status field to "Done" for them
* Do *not* change the way we query for epics to be based on workflow status
fields.summary: As an existing user of epics, I would like for epics with a resolution set to not be shown in the list of epics

fields.description: When planning sprints, we typically have a lot in our backlog that are prioritiezed by themes, epics, stories, story tasks. We would like to be able to plan sprints based on quick filters so we can base the quick filters on particular versions to narrow down our backlog. This will increase our efficieny with prioritizing things within particular versions rather than always having to pull things and order them from the huge backlog.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to plan a sprint from a quick filter rather than from the overall backlog

fields.description:
Currently the timeline order for the comment list in the rapid board and the issue page are not the same: 
* On the issue page is from the oldest one to the newest one. 
* On the rapid borad is from the newest one to the oldest one. 

This will actually confused the users.
fields.summary: The comment list in the rapid board should order with the same timeline method as in the issue page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6414].
  {panel}

Basically, it does not respect the subtasks of the same parent available in JIRA, but *only* looking of the subtask with the same parent issue on the board. If you have different *Boards* with one parent issue and many subtasks in other boards, moving one of those sub-tasks to the *Done* column will enforce the parent issue to be *Resolved* even though not all *Sub-Takses* are done. 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create project and board project_A and board_A
# Create board_B that show project_A
# Create board_C that show project_A
# Create one task with two sub tasks it project_A
# Set filters in board_B and board_C so each one of them will show one sub task
# In one of the board_B or board_C move the sub task to done
# A popup message will appear saying *All sub-tasks for parent issue XXXXX-1 are now Done*. Even only *one* sub-task is done and the others not yet.

This is also reproducible when a user divide a Board into two for the same project and workflow. Example, create a Developer Board and QA board where the Resolved/Closed JIRA status is available only in QA board. It will still prompt to closed the parent issue even if the parent issue is NOT in the same board.
fields.summary: Parent issue enforced to be resolved even though not all the sub-tasks are done

fields.description:
The problem is happening if the project key is *more than 5 characters* in Firefox:
!Firefox.png|thumbnail!

However, the problem is not reproducible in Google Chrome:
!chrome.png|thumbnail!

Workaround:
# Use another browser, for example Chrome
# Edit the [project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Project+Key] to use less than or equal to 4 characters.
fields.summary: Project key and issue summary overlapping each other in FF 16 browser
